content:
Diagnosis:
Locally advanced bladder adenosquamous carcinoma, Stage IIIA (T3bN1M0)
Molecular profile: TP53/RB1 loss

Previous treatment:
Cystoscopy and TURBT 15 Jan 2024
Commenced cisplatin-gemcitabine 12 Feb 2024

Current medications:
Ondansetron 8mg prn
Dexamethasone 4mg pre-chemotherapy

Allergies:
None known

Current situation:
Pre cycle 4 cisplatin-gemcitabine

CT 15 Apr 2024 shows partial response with reduction in bladder wall thickening and resolution of previously noted right external iliac lymphadenopathy

Blood results satisfactory - creatinine 85, neutrophils 2.8

I reviewed [redacted name] today prior to cycle 4 chemotherapy. Treatment has been well tolerated with only grade 1 nausea and mild fatigue. Performance status remains 0. Appetite is good and weight stable at 72kg. No new symptoms reported. Examination shows no concerning features.

Plan is to proceed with cycle 4 today. Will arrange CT assessment after cycle 6. Follow up in 3 weeks for cycle 5.

cancer_timeline.value: CT shows partial response with reduction in bladder wall thickening and resolution of right external iliac lymphadenopathy

status_updates.value: Stage IIIA bladder cancer showing good response to cisplatin-gemcitabine chemotherapy with partial response on imaging and good tolerability
Partial response with reduction in bladder wall thickening and resolution of lymphadenopathy
Follow up in 3 weeks for cycle 5
